about_the_job:
Job Description

Do you love solving challenging problems, thinking in numbers, and working in groups? Do you also have the self-motivation, curiosity, creativity, and ability to persuade others toward meaningful results? Are you passionate about the clean energy transition? If yes, then join our growing SEA team!

Background

RMI is an independent nonprofit founded in 1982 transforming the global energy system to secure a clean, prosperous, zero-carbon future for all. It engages businesses, communities, institutions, and entrepreneurs to accelerate the adoption of market-based solutions that cost-effectively shift from fossil fuels to efficiency and renewable.

With an independent, objective, and fact-based approach, RMI’s SEA Energy Program, working within the umbrella Global South Program, brings experience gained from engagements with regional governments, utilities, corporations, financial institutions, project developers, technology companies, and industry experts to solve the toughest energy challenges. RMI is currently working with select country partners to an energy transition that supports development goals, transitions away from fossil fuels and enables a dramatic increase in access to affordable renewable energy and energy efficiency that will bring benefits to all.

Capturing the promise of the new energy economy requires a fundamental change in how governments, regulators, utilities, funding entities, and the private sector approach energy infrastructure design, development, and operation. We use our expertise in distributed energy systems, utility business models, finance, and technology to create a robust technical and economic analysis that determines the costs and opportunities of clean, renewable, and efficient technologies.

The SEA Energy Program is focused on four complementary components: 1) electric utility transition and innovation; 2) clean energy project development; 3) transmission grid planning and market integration; and 4) the just transition of Indonesia, the Philippines, and Vietnam.

RMI is seeking an Associate reporting to the Utility Transition Manager (working within the SEA Energy Program) to support program implementation in Indonesia, Vietnam, and the Philippines.

We strongly encourage individuals from underrepresented groups to apply!

Position Overview

RMI is seeking an experienced and motivated Associate to help drive our on-the-ground activities in Indonesia, Vietnam, and the Philippines. The role will focus on conducting technical, financial, project development, and regulatory analysis on the just transition of the utilities from fossil fuels to renewable energy, as well as stakeholder engagement to implement tangible utility transition projects. A significant focus of the Utility Transition Associate’s tasks is to help the Utility Transition Manager and the wider RMI teams assess the technical, commercial, and legal/regulatory feasibility of utility transition efforts, support the project parties execute deals, and advance the development of renewable energy and storage projects in the aforementioned countries. RMI’s SEA Energy Program is growing, and this role offers an opportunity to play a key role in delivering groundbreaking utility transition analysis, establishing new partnerships, and developing innovative solutions in the SEA region.

This role reports to the Utility Transition Manager with whom you will collaborate closely on advancing RMI’s scope of work and strategy in Indonesia, Vietnam, and the Philippines. These currently include but are not limited to, analyzing and facilitating development of innovative regulatory, technical, and financial mechanisms for utility transition (including carbon credit); supporting utilities, governmental authorities, and the private sector establish bankable frameworks for energy storage solutions; project finance modeling of utility refinancing and renewable energy plus storage projects; analyzing key commercial and bankability aspects of power purchase agreements (PPAs) or wholesale market energy trading system; market sizing and scaling strategies for renewable energy projects; and capacity development for relevant stakeholders to support the just energy transition.

As an Associate, you are a creative problem solver who uses your quantitative, qualitative, technical, and analytical abilities to help stakeholders deliver tangible utility transition projects from analysis/research phase. You will collaborate with team members to craft visionary yet practical solutions for our stakeholders and clients. You will be an independent contributor and work closely with colleagues on projects under the direction of the Utility Transition Manager and other senior team leaders.

Closely work with partners, clients, and stakeholders to meet planned deliverables.
Assist in the due diligence process across a broad range of topics related to utility transition, energy storage, and/or renewable energy plus storage on an asset level.

Create innovative problem-solving approaches to drive project insights.
